title: Global HMPV Tracker: Tamil Nadu Detects 2 Cases, India's Tally Rises To 5 - NDTV
summary:
Tamil Nadu Reports First Cases of HMPV, Nationwide Tally Reaches 5

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Five cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) have been confirmed in India, with the first instances reported in Tamil Nadu. The government is monitoring the situation as concerns rise about the respiratory virus.

The following are key points from the article:

  • Two cases identified in Tamil Nadu, one each in Chennai and Salem.
  • A three-month-old baby has been discharged from the hospital, and an eight-month-old is recovering.
  • HMPV has no travel exposure links, according to health officials.
  • Guidelines reminiscent of Covid-19 protocols are issued in several states for preparedness.
  • Health experts stress that HMPV is not a new virus but has been circulating globally.
“HMPV is not a new virus. It was first identified in 2001 and has been circulating worldwide.” - Union Health Minister JP Nadda

The health ministry assures that monitoring is ongoing and the public should remain calm while following the recommended precautions.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu Reports First Cases of HMPV, Nationwide Tally Reaches 5

10 striking images of galaxies captured by NASA - DNA India
summary:
10 Striking Images of Galaxies Captured by NASA

Date: Jan 6, 2025 Source: DNA

This article features breathtaking images captured by NASA showing various galaxies, highlighting their beauty and uniqueness across the universe.

  • The bright spiral galaxy MCG-01-24-014 located about 275 million light-years from Earth.
  • The spiral galaxy IC 5332, around 30 million light-years away.
  • The tranquil spiral galaxy UGC 12295, observed by Hubble.
  • The jellyfish galaxy JO206, with star formation visible.
  • A galaxy in Pisces displaying extraordinary structures around a supermassive black hole.
  • A barred spiral galaxy that has hosted three supernovae since 1992.
  • Caldwell 5 galaxy located in the Camelopardalis constellation.
“Source: NASA”

These images offer a glimpse into the vastness of space and the stunning formations of galaxies, showcasing the ongoing exploration and observation of the cosmos.
newTitle: 10 Striking Images of Galaxies Captured by NASA

Game Changer: 2 Fans Die After Attending Ram Charan Film's Pre-Release Event; Dil Raju Offers Rs10-Lakh Aid - News18
summary:
Game Changer: 2 Fans Die After Attending Ram Charan Film's Pre-Release Event; Dil Raju Offers Rs10-Lakh Aid

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: News18

Two Ram Charan fans tragically lost their lives after attending the film's pre-release event in Rajahmundry. The families will receive financial assistance from the producer Dil Raju.

  • The victims were identified as Arava Manikanta (23) and Thokada Charan (22).
  • They were involved in a fatal accident on their way home after the event.
  • Dil Raju has pledged Rs 10 lakh to support the families affected.
  • Pawan Kalyan also promised Rs 5 lakh each to the victims’ families.
  • This incident follows another tragic event where a woman died at a Pushpa 2 screening.
“I pray that their souls rest in peace, and we will stand by and support the two families.” - Dil Raju

This sorrowful event highlights the dangers associated with large public gatherings and the importance of ensuring safety for all attendees.
newTitle: Tragic Incident at Ram Charan's Film Event Claims Two Lives

title: India's Squad For England ODIs: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma's Future Confirmed In Report Amid Rumours - NDTV Sports
summary:
Kohli and Rohit Confirmed for England ODIs Amid Selection Rumors

Publication Date: June 29, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Despite uncertainties surrounding their Test futures, Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have been confirmed for India's upcoming ODI series against England, as they remain vital for the team's performance. This news follows claims that the selection committee might exclude them, highlighting the ongoing discussions around player position and workload.

  • Kohli and Rohit confirmed for the ODI series against England starting February 6.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's participation is uncertain due to back issues.
  • The series is crucial as it precedes the ICC Champions Trophy later in February.
  • Full schedule: 1st ODI on February 6 in Nagpur, 2nd ODI on February 9 in Cuttack, 3rd ODI on February 12 in Ahmedabad.
“His workload remains of utmost importance for the teams.”

The confirmation of Kohli and Rohit reinforces their significance in the ODI format, while questions linger about Bumrah's health as the team prepares for critical upcoming matches.
newTitle: Kohli and Rohit Confirmed for England ODIs Amid Selection Rumors

Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Delhi Issue Guidelines As 3 Cases Reported In India - NDTV
summary:
Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Delhi Issue Guidelines As 3 Cases Reported In India

Date: January 6, 2025 Source: NDTV

Three cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) were confirmed in India, marking the first reported instances of the virus in the country. The Union health ministry is monitoring the situation closely.

Key Points:

  • Confirmed cases in Bengaluru and Ahmedabad.
  • Guidelines issued by Karnataka, Maharashtra, and Delhi governments.
  • Most of the Indian population is reportedly immune to HMPV.
“HMPV is not a new virus. It has been part of the circulating flu virus in India for long.” - Dr. Harshal R Salve

The outbreak has prompted precautions similar to those taken during the COVID-19 pandemic, as health officials remain vigilant.
newTitle: Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra, Delhi Issue Guidelines As 3 Cases Reported In India

Monali Thakur breaks silence on sexual harassment claims on her team, Varanasi concert fiasco: ‘Gross abuse of rights’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Monali Thakur Breaks Silence on Sexual Harassment Claims

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Hindustan Times

Monali Thakur has openly criticized the organizers of her recent concert in Varanasi over serious allegations of sexual harassment and mismanagement that her team faced, emphasizing the urgent need for reforms regarding such incidents.

  • Monali Thakur shut down her Varanasi concert due to poor management and allegations of harassment.
  • She accused the event management team of gross misconduct and exploitation of crew and vendors.
  • She shared her thoughts on social media, urging for better treatment and respect within the live entertainment industry.
  • The singer recalled being subjected to negligence and intimidation during her performance.
  • Thakur called for stricter regulations to protect artists and support staff from exploitation.
“Weaponising such laws for personal vendetta... is both appalling and unacceptable,” Monali stated.

In conclusion, Monali Thakur's statements serve as a powerful reminder of the importance of fair treatment and safety in the entertainment industry, spotlighting the necessity for stronger protective measures for all involved.
newTitle: Monali Thakur Addresses Allegations of Sexual Harassment and Poor Management at Varanasi Concert

Advance tech is the basis of India- US future ties : NSA Sullivan - Hindustan Times
summary:
Advance tech is the basis of India- US future ties : NSA Sullivan

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi met United States National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan on his farewell visit to India, discussing the future relationship between the two nations based on advanced technology.

  • Sullivan's visit comes as he prepares to leave office with the impending inauguration of Donald Trump.
  • The importance of the Initiative on Critical and Emerging Technology (iCET) was highlighted, aiming to enhance collaboration in fields like AI, semiconductors, and defense.
  • Sullivan noted that the U.S. is finalizing steps to enable civil nuclear cooperation between the two countries.
  • Prior discussions included meetings with Indian officials including National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar.
“Advanced technologies of the future should take the relationship into the future…to make the world a better place for everyone.” - Jake Sullivan

The ongoing discussions between India and the U.S. signify a deepening partnership that is expected to pave new pathways in technology and defense cooperation.
newTitle: Advance tech is the basis of India- US future ties : NSA Sullivan

Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue was subscribed 13.32x as NIIs led bid; Check GMP, subscription data | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates

Date: 6 Jan, 2025 Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

The Standard Glass Lining IPO launches today with a price band of ₹133-140 per share, aiming to raise ₹410.05 crore. The issue was subscribed 13.32x on the first day as NIIs led the bidding.

  • The IPO opened for subscription on January 6 and will close on January 8.
  • It secured ₹123 crore from anchor investors ahead of the launch.
  • Reviews indicate substantial interest, with shares trading at a ₹97 premium in the grey market.
  • The issue consists of a fresh issuance and an offer for sale of shares by promoters.
  • Proceeds will be allocated for debt repayment and investment in a subsidiary.
The NII portion led the bidding round at 25.43x, followed by retail investors at 14.46x.

In summary, the Standard Glass Lining IPO is generating significant interest, reflecting a positive market outlook.
newTitle: Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1 Live Updates: High Demand for Initial Public Offering
